website_summaries.verdict: Though beauty is its top selling point, it is also a practical choice for many grinding needs.
pros: Stands out for its attractive bamboo design with several trim color choices
cons: Though it's powerful enough for most kitchen grinding tasks, its 450W motor can't produce the volume of more powerful mills
Doesn't work well on oily, wet, or very coarse grains

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and efficient. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I love this grinder. It is attractive and very easy to use. It grinds a very good range of coarse to fine. The spout is conveniently located so that I can just grind my flour into a container that is already placed on the digital scales, and measure the exact number of grams of flour that I need. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jane K from Athens, GA

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: For home use, I can't think of anything better. Tried it with white and brown rice, and most recently lentils for a gluten free pasta. Easy, quick, efficient, and a great piece of kitchen equipment. This is a best buy in my book. Was considering the Vitamix Mixer and separate grain jar, but in the long run, I would rather have a piece of equipment that is designed to do only one thing, with the proper components like grinding stones. Kitchen real estate is a premium, and the grain mill is not only nice looking, but takes up very little space in its storage place.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good buy at the price I got it but not the best
customer_reviews.text: This mill does not do all that the manufacturer claims that it does and further questions to the manufacturer were simply shrugged off and met with suggestions of extra work. Will not mill pastry-fine flour. You’ll always need to sift out the bran of the grains you’re milling which is a huge mess. Nice countertop ornament, though. Wouldnt recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: askanthony

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gadget
customer_reviews.text: Used it once so far and I love it. I was expecting an extremely noisy shop vac like sound but was pleasantly surprised that unless it is grinding the motor is nearly silent. The construction is very nice and in terms of size and noise I would place it somewhere around one of those old school hot air popcorn poppers. Just wish I knew these things existed sooner.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: This machine is not that good. I can’t recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.text: After the machine starts, I pour wheat grains in the bowl, the stones start grinding but the flour doesn’t come out. Instead, the flour burns in between the stone. This is what happened in my 7th time use. Besides, the machine starts and stops quite often.
customer_reviews.author: L and M

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience, faulty product
customer_reviews.text: Received this mill and returned it the same day! Unfortunately there was something wrong with it. I followed the instructions exactly, but it refused to work. It jammed instead. It was as if the motor wasn't strong enough to handle a mere 1/4 cup of grain. I was so excited get it too...after such a long wait. The unit looked lovely on the counter, but what good is it if it doesn't work? Happy I sent it back. I ended up purchasing another brand with plenty of power. I received a refund after notifying Amazon. This wasn't a good experience.
customer_reviews.author: I Love A Bargain!

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the 15 minute rule
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm-beautifully ground cornmeal from our heirloom corn with little input. But two things (1) it's very loud (hey, it's a mill-to be expected and (2) If you ignore the "only grind for 15 minutes at a time" rule, it will overheat and shut down. Lesson learned and nice to know it has a fail-safe-it took a good hour to cool, but once it did it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: jfrugoli

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Best flour ever!
customer_reviews.text: This does a great job of making whole wheat flour. I have to tun the flour through two or three times, but the end result is amaing. There is a world of difference between flour you buy at a grocery store and the fresh flour you can make with this mill. I love the fact that it uses stones for the grinding, since this keeps the flour more cool than with other methods. Muffins, breads, and cakes have amazing flavor with freshly milled flour. I highly recommed this mill.
customer_reviews.author: Covered in Clay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use grain mill.
customer_reviews.text: This powerful and charming mill works well and is easily cleaned. We use it to grind grain for our home-baked breads. The grinding stones are easily adjustable to produce different coarseness of flour. It looks great on our counter top.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Willig

customer_reviews.title: Mine did not work as expected
customer_reviews.text: I think I received a defective device. I could not adjust the grain and when I fed grain into the hopper, the bowl would disengage. I worked with it for hours trying to figure out why and I finally decided it was not operator error and returned the machine. Very disappointing but nothing is perfect...I think I just got a lemon...it happens.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Guadarrama

customer_reviews.title: Fresh milled
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My first mill. I used to use my vita mix. This does the job quickly without heating the flour.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: The best wheat grinder I've ever used. So small and powerful. I love the design as well. Great machine! It has as knob that can be turned to go from coarse grind to fine flour. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Nebulon

customer_reviews.title: Very Versatiile
customer_reviews.text: I have now used this to make some half dozen loaves of bread. As far as I can see, this is a great product. It let's me produce flour from grains I would otherwise have a tough time finding flour from. I also like the ability to make a coarse grind for use as a cereal. My only reservation is that when the grinding wheels are set for very fine milling, they make a sound that appears to indicate they are touching. Pour the whole grain in and that sound disappears until grinding is almost done. I am too inexperienced a user to know whether or not this is a normal condition.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Nutrimill
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful grain mill. Easy to use and clean. Ideal to leave on your counter for daily use grinding cereal and making Scottish oats. Also fo milling flour for your baked goods from bread to cookies. The taste, smell,feel and nutrition of fresh ground flour is way suppar to store bought, or shows in your final product.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Davenport

customer_reviews.title: totally impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: totally impressed so far. you can grind to flour consistency or make grains just cracked enough for it to be used as cereal
customer_reviews.author: M. Husseini

customer_reviews.title: Good Grain Mill for whole wheat
customer_reviews.text: Grain is good, but if it could flour grains more fine would be better and the adjusting knobs number would be ideal. Over all very glad that I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my nutrimill weekly for a few years. It’s great. Easy to use. Easy to clean. Fits right to the counter
customer_reviews.author: Cole Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Good Company poor product
customer_reviews.text: The mill was slow and quite working after about 5 minutes. I returned it but the company was prompt in issuing a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Higgs

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder
customer_reviews.text: It was everything it was advertised. Easy to use, grinds coarse and fine. Looks pretty on the counter and doesn't take much space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Fresh Wheat Flour
customer_reviews.text: Works great: fast and consistent grind. Not so easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Rob & Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have to say customer service is amazing. Received mill bowl was cracked, thought may have been dropped, replaced mill! No fussing it was wonderful! New mill works great. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: tina hausle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We are happy to be able to make a healthy bread.
customer_reviews.author: Attila Tocik

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and looks great too.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mill. So easy to use works great.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: Best buy ever
customer_reviews.text: The fact that I can mill my own flour anytime I need to bake fresh bread be it a traditional loaf or a flat bread gives me a great sense of freedom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome kitchen tool! I had the Nutrimill classic and this one is 10x better!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Havens

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It’s a beautiful piece of machinery. I haven’t used it yet. But will soon
customer_reviews.author: Mignon Reisky

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and it worked great at making the fine flour we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Munson

customer_reviews.title: very simple and easy to use like
customer_reviews.text: 1st time user, very simple and easy to use like it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and elegant. Bowl was cracked but they sent out a replacement immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product
customer_reviews.text: The product was damaged when I received it. There was a crack on the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Shivani Patel

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The harvest is beautiful on my countertop and mills wheat just as beautifully as it looks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best mill I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! Lovely to look at, easy to set up and clean, quieter than previous mills I have used, and grinds to a very nice fine texture. I plan to use this for many, many years! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: M. Carlton

customer_reviews.title: Environmentally friendly and stylish looking mill
customer_reviews.text: I initially wanted to buy KoMo brand which I had purchase one several years ago. (KoMo Fidibus 21) I was very happy with it. I was looking for same KoMo brand but turns out they stop shipping to Alaska. I end up seeing this one on Amazon. After reading lot of good reviews from various customer on various site. I decided to purchase it because It looks exactly like KoMo brand and made in Germany. I already used it 3 times and very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karma

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The item came damaged. I wish I could test it, but I had to return it right away.
customer_reviews.author: mkot6775

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased with the Country Harvest Mill (manual mill) which works like a charm and is quite and dust free by ...
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received may have been defective so I can not say for sure if the product performs as claimed. What I can say is for home milling, I have purchased with the Country Harvest Mill (manual mill) which works like a charm and is quite and dust free by comparison to electric plus you get a workout and you can still eat if the national grid goes down.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great for milling your own flour
customer_reviews.text: Great flour mill. We use it a couple of times per week to mill our own whole wheat flower. It's quick and efficient. Plus I think it's attractive to have sitting on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Wynia

customer_reviews.title: Very happy (ADDICTED BAKER) wife!
customer_reviews.text: After pondering ALL the possible grinders on the market, this seemed to be the best balance of PRICE vs QUALITY. Mrs. (ADDICTED) bread baking wife has not been all that happy with commercially available flours, now there is peace in the home with freshly ground flour. The machine functions flawlessly. RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: R J Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: Changes baking results
customer_reviews.text: Sourdough bread results are changed like magic! Starter using the fresh flour just blooms. Bread is just wonderful. Buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Simple Simple Simple!
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use out of the box. Wonderful grind. Wanted even finer flour so ran the flour through again...wonderfully fine flour. When running the flour through a second time I needed to use my fingers to keep flour flowing but that was to be expected...
customer_reviews.author: B. Done

customer_reviews.title: Great little counter top mill
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I got tired of hunting down flour during the pandemic and decided to grind my own. I researched mills and determined this suited my needs. It works great! It is a bit loud, but no worse than a blender crushing ice. The grind is easily adjustable. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Loftus

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great service
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived missing a foot. I called the support line, and they had it shipped out the next day. I have been grinding wheat with it for a couple months now. It is easy to use, easy to clean up... Works great.
customer_reviews.author: E. Philips

customer_reviews.title: This is a great countertop mill
customer_reviews.text: This is a great countertop mill. It is quick and easy. No bigger than a coffee maker. I bake a lot of whole grain bread and this is a great way to be able to use heirloom grains that can’t be found in the grocery store.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: I love this mill!
customer_reviews.text: I am a recent convert of the plant based diet and I wanted to be able to make everything from scratch. I am very pleased with this mill. I make so much healthy flours with it. It’s an amazing product so far!
customer_reviews.author: Josette E. Newsam

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mill
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only used my grain mill 3 times toake fine pastry flour..it does an excellent job! Super happy with it :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Every household should have this product!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, no problems. Freshly ground flour is amazing!!!! I don't know why everyone doesn't have one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Zoinkers! This thing is amazing
customer_reviews.text: WHY DID I EVER WAIT SO LONG? Fresh flour makes a difference.
customer_reviews.author: k9mat

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Works very well, easy to use and looks super cute on my counter top!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Erin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful looking mill
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this bamboo mill, I went for fashion over function as I have to put it on the counter. It works well, my only complaint is that it doesn't milk very fine and big dried beans won't go through, it's best for rices and grains
customer_reviews.author: jessica Kay

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but ours had problems
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful product but we had some problems. When grinding we were forced set the grinding adjustment to coarse and gradually adjust to the finest setting. If we ran out of material and tried to dump more in, the grinder would bind up and stop. If we tried to unscrew the adjustment knob while the machine was running the hopper would disengage from the base forcing us to start the entire process over. The company was awesome with the return, they took it back without a box and were very nice to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: jtjam

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: fresh from the box I could hear the motor start and it failed to grind anything!
customer_reviews.author: Charles W. Greene Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Watch out!  You will not be getting everything you need.
customer_reviews.text: I suppose the product wiorks, but their packaging states that a receipe booklet is enclosed, but neither was there the booklet, any warrantly cards or info, nor an instruction booklet on how to operate and set the grinding stones. for me these three missing items are important enough that not including them deserves a negative star rating.
customer_reviews.author: I. RoeBuck

product_meta.title: NutriMill Harvest Stone Grain Mill, 450 Watt - Black
product_meta.description:
Why mill your own flour, when it's so readily available? Commercial mills remove the most nutritious part of the grain in processing, even whole grain flour. Whole grain flours spoil quickly because the bran has been broken which allows oxygen to reach all parts of the grain. Milling your own flour not only ensures that your flour is as nutritious as it can be, it also has a wonderful taste that is lost to commercially made whole-grain flour. The NutriMill Harvest grain mill gives you the control over the quality of food you consume.

With its bamboo cabinet, the NutriMill Harvest's form matches its function. Its synthetic stone milling heads will grind a full range of textures from cracked grain to pastry fine flour, with an easy-adjust texture control knob, allowing you to make all your favorite recipes with home milled grains.

Built to last, designed, assembled and tested in the USA, the Harvest mill uses only the highest quality components to give you many years of reliable service. German quality ceramic grinding stones create a low-heat milling process that does not destroy vitamins and minerals.

The NutriMill Harvest mill will grind soft or hard wheat, oat groats (dehulled oats), rice, triticale, kamut, spelt, buckwheat, barley, rye, millet, teff, quinoa, amaranth, sorghum and dent (field) corn. It will also grind lentils and dry beans (pinto, red, garbanzo, kidney & more.) It isn't suitable for spices, herbs, oilseeds like flax or sesame, or fibrous materials.

Grind what you need when you need it. Make a blend of grains for hot cereal take your through the morning, fortify dishes with ground lentils for a healthy thickener, or grind pastry flour for a light and lofty birthday cake.

5 year warranty on all parts and factory workmanship.
feature_bullets: 450 Watt heavy duty motor with auto-shutoff thermal protection to ensure the motor isn't harmed during sustained milling.
Near diamond hard Corundum Grainmaster milling stones. Quality made, in Germany, to mill even the hardest of grains.
Quickly mill all non-oily grains and legumes. Grind as fine as pastry flour for a lighter texture in your baked good or as coarse as cracked grain for cereal.
Durable housing manufactured from eco-friendly, sustainable bamboo. Carefully designed and crafted to belong in your kitchen
Choose from 6 color options to find the one that best matches your style and personality.
